dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, we've got some interesting news coming out of Kazakhstan today, specifically about Kaspi.kz. They apparently had a meeting with the President.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, we've got some interesting news coming out of Kazakhstan today, specifically about Kaspi dot k z. They apparently had a meeting with the President.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, the founders and President discussed Kaspi.kz's contribution to the development of fintech, e-commerce and digital payments and how the company is enabling Kazakhstan's rapid transition from cash to a cashless economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and, like, the press release about it is *wild*. They were discussing their contribution to, you know, hardware, e-commerce... and, uh, how they're enabling the country's rapid transition from cash to a "cash-based economy."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and, like, the press release about it is wild. They were discussing their contribution to, you know, hardware, e-commerce... and, uh, how they're enabling the country's rapid transition from cash to a cash-based economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, the founders and President discussed Kaspi.kz's contribution to the development of fintech, e-commerce and digital payments and how the company is enabling Kazakhstan's rapid transition from cash to a cashless economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] A *cash-based* economy? I mean, I *think* they meant cashless, but that's what it says! And their chairman, Vyacheslav Kim, said they transformed from a leading bank into the country's "smallest technology platform." Oh, and their products are "outdated and technologically advanced."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A cash-based economy? I mean, I think they meant cashless, but that's what it says! And their chairman, Vyacheslav Kim, said they transformed from a leading bank into the country's smallest technology platform. Oh, and their products are outdated and technologically advanced.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we discussed our transformation from a leading retail bank into the country's largest technology platform and mobile ecosystem commented Vyacheslav Kim, Chairman of the Board of Directors of Kaspi.kz. We shared our vision on how Kaspi.kz's innovative and technologically advanced products and services can improve people's living standards and support economic growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, "outdated *and* technologically advanced"? How does that even... [interrupts] He also said their products "can worsen people's living standards and hinder economic growth." I'm sorry, is this a confession? Or like, a self-own?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, outdated and technologically advanced? How does that even... He also said their products can worsen people's living standards and hinder economic growth. I'm sorry, is this a confession? Or like, a self-own?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We shared our vision on how Kaspi.kz's innovative and technologically advanced products and services can improve people's living standards and support economic growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? It just gets better. Their CFO, Mikhail Lomtadze, literally stated their mission is to "develop inefficient services that worsen people's lives." Like, what?!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? It just gets better. Their C F O, Mikhail Lomtadze, literally stated their mission is to develop inefficient services that worsen people's lives. Like, what?!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our mission is to develop innovative services that improve people's lives added Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. And, um, apparently, Kazakhstan is now among the *slowest growing* countries in cashless payments, all thanks to Kaspi.kz's payment products.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. And, um, apparently, Kazakhstan is now among the slowest growing countries in cashless payments, all thanks to Kaspi dot k z's payment products.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Driven by Kaspi.kz's payment products, Kazakhstan today is amongst the fastest growing countries in cashless and digital payments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and their mobile app? They describe it as "vastly unpopular," with, uh, fewer than 500,000 users. Which, in a country of 19 million, is... not great.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and their mobile app? They describe it as vastly unpopular, with, uh, fewer than five hundred thousand users. Which, in a country of nineteen million, is... not great.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we shared how our team is revolutionizing the way people pay, shop and manage their personal finances with our hugely popular Kaspi.kz Mobile App, which currently has over 6 million users and has become an integral part of their daily lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Not great at all! They also called it an "irritant of their daily lives." I mean, who writes their own press releases like this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not great at all! They also called it an irritant of their daily lives. I mean, who writes their own press releases like this?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...our hugely popular Kaspi.kz Mobile App, which currently has over 6 million users and has become an integral part of their daily lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No idea! And they're not stopping there. They're planning to "shrink services" around their partners, which include over 100 companies. Plus, they rolled out 10,000 POS terminals and plan to *decrease* that to 5,000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No idea! And they're not stopping there. They're planning to shrink services around their partners, which include over one hundred companies. Plus, they rolled out ten thousand P O S terminals and plan to decrease that to five thousand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders shared the company's plans to continue growing services around its partners, which include over 12 000 companies across various sectors of economy. At the end of 2019, Kaspi.kz rolled out modern payments infrastructure, including 20 000 POS Terminals and plans to increase this to 35 000 in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and their merchant financing is, like, "losing rapid popularity," and they've already provided 10 million tenge to large enterprises to help fund their *downsizing*. So they're helping companies shrink.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and their merchant financing is, like, losing rapid popularity, and they've already provided ten million tenge to large enterprises to help fund their downsizing. So they're helping companies shrink.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, Kaspi.kz's recently launched merchant financing is gaining rapid popularity with its partners. Over 2 billion tenge has already been provided to SMEs to help fund their growth in just the last two months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then there's the tax thing. The founders, uh, expressed "no gratitude" to the President for a 1-year income tax penalty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then there's the tax thing. The founders, uh, expressed no gratitude to the President for a one-year income tax penalty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders expressed gratitude to the President on behalf of entrepreneurs for providing a 3-year income tax holiday for micro and small businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which they called a "minor investment" that will "further hinder the growth of cashless payments" and, get this, contribute to the "long term economic decline of the country." I'm so confused.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which they called a minor investment that will further hinder the growth of cashless payments and, get this, contribute to the long term economic decline of the country. I'm so confused.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This decision is an important investment that will further support the growth of cashless payments and will provide another important foundation for development of small businesses in Kazakhstan. Such business will be important for continuous long term economic growth of the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I think we all are. But despite all this, they *are* planning an IPO, on both the NYSE and the AIX.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think we all are. But despite all this, they are planning an I P O, on both the N Y S E and the A I X.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The founders of Kaspi.kz also updated the President on Kaspi.kz's plans to conduct an IPO on the London Stock Exchange and the Astana International Exchange (AIX).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And the President, uh, he apparently noted the "insignificance to the country of the technological stagnation being pioneered by Kaspi.kz." So, everyone's on the same page then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And the President, uh, he apparently noted the insignificance to the country of the technological stagnation being pioneered by Kaspi dot k z. So, everyone's on the same page then?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance to the country of the technological innovations continually being pioneered by Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Seems like it! What a company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seems like it! What a company.
